item.description:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:39, topic:342485”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=438891.msg3226642#msg3226642 date=1275638270]

Hmm, what if they banned all guns so stuff like this would never happen again? What? They already did years ago? IT’S NOT WORKING!!!

Idiots (in the british government), if you outlaw guns, only outlaws like this loon will have them and use them, and then all of the victims have nothing to defend themselves with. If a guy tried this where I live, chances are he wouldn’t kill many people at all until someone else killed him in self defense.

Yeah, the differences is shootings like this are a weekly tradition in the US. The last one like this was in 1996 in britain.

No country is ever going to eliminate gun crime, but I’d say the UK has done a pretty good job at reducing it compared to other countries.

Yes, less people would have died if the people had guns which they could use to shoot the lunatic, but we’d just end up having more gun related crimes which means more deaths.
[/quote]

Who cares what the crime is committed with? A bow, gun, knife, bat or bazooka. The fact is that since the UK banned guns, crime in the UK has skyrocketed since the law-abiding citizens are defenseless.

@MITB: the shootings that occur in Europe are mostly done by loons. Loons who got their hands on a gun because they, or a relative was allowed to own a gun legally. Last year a German kid shot some of his fellow students. He used his fathers gun, for which his father had a permit. A lot of these shootings are done by relatives of those who are allowed to own a gun. The owner can be a stable person, but his family isn’t checked. Putting a gun in a safe doesn’t mean that your son can’t use it.

That seems like a pretty fair statement. I think anyone, anywhere, who goes around killing people is a loon. Including here in the USA. The difference is that here the potential victims have the right to defend themselves, so this is a deterrent if the person isn’t too crazy, and if they are too crazy then law-abiding citizens with guns can put a stop to the killing without waiting for the police who may not get there until it is too late.[/quote]

um… If thats true why is the government releasing official crime statistics showing crime is decreasing?

ANYWAY

Thug-life:

Also, the large majority of the gun crime that does occur in this country is all targeted, they’re not random attacks on civilians. These mass shootings are most of the time, not carried out criminals - they’re ordinary people who for whatever reason have had that switch flipped and then gone on their little rampage.

I believe that is how it is in every country. Non-insane criminals aren’t going to go on a murdering rampage, there is no money in it. However they will rob, rape, or commit other crimes at gunpoint and sometimes kill during the commission. A large deterrent to this is knowing that their target on any given day could be armed with and trained to use a gun, obviously if guns are illegal this pretty much goes away all together.

item.title: Gunman kills 12 people in Cumbria rampage
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

goatee:

I just want an outright ban on guns in the UK, other than culling and policing we don’t need them at all.

Yeah, way to treat all sports shooters as second class citizens. Don’t kid yourself, guns have many valid uses besides self defence and only a fool would disagree.
“Hi, you can’t participate in your olympic sport anymore because guns are now banned.”

Also, you are all REALLY underestimating the ease with which someone can obtain a firearm unlawfully. Two years ago I would have (and often did) spout the same shit – I believe I have even done so on this very forum.
And then my mum remarried, so now I have a stepfather who works as a gunsmith (he’s the youngest in the state of NSW, and probably the country, at 41 years of age).
The first thing I discovered is the prominence of illegal firearms, which surprised me; I thought they only existed in the deepest, darkest corners of the continent. The truth is that a trip to the local pub and a talk to a perhaps shady looking character can get you one.

So it’s not true that banning them completely would work. In fact, it’s a stupid mistake to make. This is Australia that I’m talking about – we don’t have neighbouring countries that guns can be smuggled from. The UK on the other hand is part of the EU.
There’s never going to be a shortage of illegal weapons, despite the wishes of any government.
